intro: Grewia cyclopetala, commonly known as the African starfruit or sour fig, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped fruits that turn yellow when ripe. The plant produces clusters of white flowers that are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture with prominent veins. The fruit is edible, though its tart flavor makes it popular in local cuisines and traditional medicine.
